Top 5 features that make the Panasonic Eluga Ray 700 a great buy for multimedia addicts

By
Brand Story
-
Published On: October 17, 2017 | Last Updated: October 20, 2017

“The Panasonic Eluga Ray 700 features a 5.5-inch display, a MediaTek MT6753 SoC and 3GB of RAM”

Saying that the Indian smartphone market is saturated might actually be an understatement. While on one hand, a large variety of phones means a wider range of choices to choose from, it also has its downsides. Unfortunately, with so many devices being launched each passing day, a few capable phones don’t get the limelight they deserve. In fact, some of these phones are actually pretty good, right from the build and hardware to the software. One such device is the recently-launched Panasonic Eluga Ray 700. And in case you aren’t aware of the key features of the device, we’re here to the rescue. We’ve compiled a list of the top five reasons why the Eluga Ray 700 might be a perfect device for the youth, who love consuming multimedia content on their smartphones. Let’s get right to it.

Table of Contents

  • A crisp display
  • Powerful speakers
  • A long-lasting battery
  • Split the screen to watch and do something else at the same time 
  • A complete package that’s priced affordably

A crisp display

That’s the first thing you want, right? A canvas that is clear, vibrant and sharp and has the capability to display media the way it is supposed to be. Despite being in a budget segment, Panasonic has equipped the Eluga Ray 700 with a large 5.5-inch full HD display. A few quick calculations and you’d realise that translates to an impressive pixel density of about 401ppi. Furthermore, a 5.5-inch screen ensures that it is big enough to enjoy your media, while being pocketable enough to ensure ergonomic handling. 

Powerful speakers

Okay, what’s the next thing you look for in a great multimedia experience after the visuals? Audio, correct. Thankfully, unlike its peers, the Eluga Ray 700 comes with a powerful K class speaker that delivers a clear and immersive audio experience. The speaker output is adequately loud, and ensures listening to songs becomes an everyday affair. And then again, the phone has a headphone jack for times you don’t want to disturb the people around you.

A long-lasting battery

An excellent display… check. Great speaker… check. That’s more or less what you’d need for a great media experience, right? Wrong. What if after every couple of hours of watching YouTube videos, you’ve to sit tethered to the wall socket, just because your phone ran out of juice? Battery life is important, and the Panasonic Eluga Ray 700 has a big… big battery inside. It’s fueled by a mammoth 5,000mAh battery that would easily let you binge watch your favourite shows without requiring a charge. In fact, it won’t give up even on a heavy usage as the brand promises a talk time of up to 17 hours and 30 minutes. 

Split the screen to watch and do something else at the same time 

With the Eluga Ray 700 running Android 7.0 Nougat out of the box, users also have access to the split screen functionality of the operating system. This means you can watch a video and play a game of chain reaction simultaneously, or even make notes and browse the internet at the same time. The Split screen might seem like a little additional feature, but in reality, it opens the gate to a whole new world of possibilities. Do what matters to you, multitask how you like and make your phone truly yours.

A complete package that’s priced affordably

In addition to the aforementioned features, the Panasonic Eluga Ray 700 also packs a capable hardware and software. This includes an octa-core MediaTek MT6753 SoC, 3GB of RAM, 32GB expandable upto 128 GB, a multi-function front fingerprint scanner and even the ARBO AI assistant. For the optics, the phone comes with a 13MP camera on both the rear and the front, with both sensors getting their own flash units for improved low-light photography. All this at a price point of just Rs 9,999, making the Eluga Ray 700 a solid value-for-money offering. The device is available to buy exclusively via Flipkart.

This is a sponsored post
